attributes.action: Parliament to debate the misleading information by the EU Leave Campaign
attributes.background:
The nation's decision on Europe must be based wholly upon an informed choice and not upon misleading campaigns of false information provided by the Leave Campaign.
We ask such debate to take place in Parliament before any debate enacting Article 50 or any vote on it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/16/nigel-farage-defends-ukip-breaking-point-poster-queue-of-migrants
http://m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_576e2967e4b08d2c56393241?edition=uk 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36353013
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6H8TA631ou0 and http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/eu-referendum-result-nigel-farage-nhs-pledge-disowns-350-million-pounds-a7099906.html
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/3-brexit-promises-campaigners-wriggled-8271762 and 
http://qz.com/715877/the-backtracking-on-promises-by-brexit-campaigners-has-already-begun/

attributes.action: At least 40% of those eligible to vote in a referendum must support change.
attributes.background: The Trade Union Act 2016 requires that at least 40% of those eligible to vote must back action for strikes in core public services. This is to limit disruption caused by an unrepresentative result. The same logic and rules should apply to a referendum, especially on important constitutional areas.

attributes.action: Referendum on full access to EU single market before invoking Article 50.
attributes.background: Whilst respecting the EU Referendum result the Leave Campaign failed to definitively address with the electorate the issue of access to the single market. This petition seeks to ensure that full access is negotiated before Article 50 is invoked. If this cannot be achieved a referendum must be held.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on the UK joining the European Free Trade Association (EFTA)
attributes.background: EFTA is a free trade area and currently includes Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland. It operates in parallel with the EU, and all its member states participate in the EU's single market. Norway rejected membership of the EU in national referendums in 1973 and 1995, but stayed in EFTA.

attributes.action: Create an independent state in Exeter, Devon and apply to join the EU.
attributes.background: Exeter people voted over 55% to remain in the EU.  Exeter is a thriving aspirational city with a very bright future has an expanding population.  Exeter has a bright future within EU, a distinctive culture and a world renowned food and produce heritage as well as a magnet for international business.

attributes.action: Give EU nationals living in the UK for 4 years or more automatic citizenship now
attributes.background:
We are asking parliament give citizenship to EU migrants living in the UK for more than 4 years to:

- prevent the loss of skilled workers
- honour year long contributions into the system 
- give re-assurance to over 3m EU migrants 
- make sure in future all views are represented and respected
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not meant to be exclusive. Non-EU migrants have a clear set of defined rules however hence our friends are covered already and know where the road gores - WE DO NOT and need answers now from a country that has left us hanging. We represent almost 5% of the UK pubic - yet have no voice. 
4 years are based on the decisions made in the re-negotiations between the UK and the EU commission in Feb 2016. This petition follows the same rational (4 years entitle to benefits for example)

attributes.action: Let us know the economic plan for departing the European Union. Immediately.
attributes.background: An economic plan for leaving the European Union was vague during the leave campaign. In the 24 hours post-brexit we have seen the decline of the GBP, businesses announcing they're leaving and the USA saying the UK goes to the back of the queue for a trade deal. We need to know what the plan is, now.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/23/eu-referendum-what-the-world-is-saying---britains-historic-decis/ 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36611512

attributes.action: Improve refugee policies! Create Syrian refugee policies similar to Germany's!
attributes.background: Five years a war has been raging in Syria! Thousands of innocents are being killed! Millions more are pouring out of Syria, desperate to get to Europe. Instead of doing our utmost to help them we have barred them from our doors! The amount of refugees we've admitted would fit on a train!
attributes.additional_details: Under great pressure the government decided to allow UNNACOMPANIED CHILDREN to enter the country. Apparently nobody likes looking at pictures of 2yr olds and knowing we've sentenced them to death! But it's not just toddlers who can die crossing the Channel. The sight of emaciated 30yr olds huddling on the ground, trying to keep warm should hurt too! Where is your compassion Brits? Where is your pity?

attributes.action: Create new Special Economic Zone for London, NI & Scotland which remains in EU
attributes.background: Although a majority of the UK voted to leave the EU a large majority of those in London, NI and Scotland voted to remain. These areas will suffer the most from the UK leaving the EU. Special Economic Zones have been created in many countries, including China, with much success.
attributes.additional_details:
We know the EU isn't perfect and needs radical reform but for many in the UK that doesn't mean we should leave it. This petition requests that the creation of a Special Economic Zone is discussed in Parliament. This Zone would remain a member of the EU and contain London, and perhaps other interested contiguous regions.

This SEZ would enable these regions to continue trading from within the EU thereby fostering increased trade, investment and job creation.

attributes.action: Make all Diesel power plant applications require Environmental Impact Assessment
attributes.background: There are £175m in subsidies to build heavily polluting diesel power plants to provide the UK with backup energy generating capacity. Bizarrely these require less Environmental impact assessment than a single wind turbine.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any MP to tell lies in Parliament, or to the Public.
attributes.background: It is totally unfair that MP's can consider that their jobs allows them to be dishonest with both Parliament, and the General Public, with no consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at how many MP's have been accused of lying in the Euro Debate.  How are the Public meant to know what to vote for, when all they are hearing are called lies!

attributes.action: A motion of no confidence be brought against this government.
attributes.background: A motion of no confidence be brought against this government for misleading and lying to the general public over Britex.
attributes.additional_details: Half of the government say that the other half is not telling the truth, so it must be true that at least one half is not telling the truth according to our own elected representatives

attributes.action: Make all UK schools enforce their school bullying policies legally
attributes.background: Schools legally have to have bullying policies but they do not legally have to enforce their policies as they currently only have discretionary meaning. They legally don't have any powers to enforce their policies and this has to be changed for safety well-being of all children's no 1 priority.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics released say 1.5 million pupils are bullied verbally or physically or both in the last 12 months which was on national news TV etc. Therefore it's children's and pupils' lives that are being ruined and destroyed and society in general and schools are failing to act cause of current policies and legislations and have no powers.
attributes.creator_name: Stephen McCulloch On Behalf Of Anti Bullying Ambassadors

attributes.action: Keep RAF Halton open
attributes.background: The MOD are considering fully shutting down RAF Halton by 2022. Although this is in line with the ''Better Defence Estate' Strategy, which aims to contribute to the government's housing target, this site contains some on the UK's best RAF memorabilia and it would be a a shame to see this place gone.
attributes.additional_details: http://forces.tv/48967067

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Service to calculate payments based on annual basic net pay.
attributes.background: Calculations shouldn't include overtime, shift allowances nor any bonuses.
attributes.additional_details: Receiving parents to provide evidence of what they spend child maintenance on

attributes.action: Change of Law: MPs must stand down after serving a constituency for 10 years.
attributes.background: Nearly 10% of current UK MPs have been active for over 25 years. Nearly 20% of MPs have been active for over 20 years. The world has changed vastly since 1996, yet nearly 1/5 of MPs have been serving since then. Excessive continuous service prevents real political change for the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Rt Hon. Sir Gerald Kaufman, The Rt Hon. Kenneth Clarke, The Rt Hon. Michael Meacher & Dennis Skinner have been active since 1970 - nearly 37 years making decisions for our country. The term 'Father of the House' is unsettling. We should be a progressive country, not a frozen one. Change is healthy. Fresh ideas and fresh actions are needed now more than ever.

attributes.action: Insurance for cyclists
attributes.background: Cyclists use the road on a day to day basis. If they use the road, they should have to pay for it like we do. If they crash into your car causing damage, you end up footing the cost and losing your No Claims Bonus. They should have their own insurance for using the road.
attributes.additional_details: A car is damaged by a cyclists cycling without due care and attention, who has to pay for the damage? You do through your insurance which has a great affect on you. If that was a car, their insurance would pay so therefore cyclists should be treated the same and have to have insurance to cover themselves. This also means obeying the rules of the road such as stopping at red-lights and not using bus lanes.

attributes.action: Make it an offence Not to have a 'Poo Bag' on them in a Public Area.
attributes.background: With a number of Dog Owners 'NOT' picking up their Dogs Fouling Footpaths, Common ground and All other Public places, something needs to be done, Owners when asked 'Must' produce a waste bag or face a Fine or Ticket, also it makes sense that these Bags are Biodegradable which is not the case now.
attributes.additional_details:
We walk our dog and see in just our small area Owners pretend to pick it up with no bag in their hands and walk off after looking around, children and adults walk on it, on footpaths around schools a large amount left, it creates a Health issue as well as a long term Environmental impact with some owners after picking it up throw the bag into an overgrown area with the bags not breaking down.

This needs to be included in the Dog act with the Police having a scanner for chips and other checks.

attributes.action: No Trump in the UK if he deports Muslim citizens from US with no terror links
attributes.background: We believe that the UK is a multicultural country and if Donald Trump begins to deport Muslim citizens from US with no terror links this is clearly for racial reasons. If the UK government allows him to enter this suggests that they agree with and support his policies.

attributes.action: Investigate motor insurance policy pricing to ensure it is fair for everyone.
attributes.background: Motor insurance is a legal requirement and a social utility, but the transparency in policy pricing and post inception activities of insurers in recent years, is disadvantaging consumers and was not addressed in the Competitions and Markets Authority's investigate of 2013/14.
attributes.additional_details: The recent article from uSwitch.com, ( http://tinyurl.com/z2w83bh ), highlights that those seeking to save money by opting for third party only or third party fire and theft cover, are actually being charged more than for comprehensive cover. As motor insurance is a legal requirement, it is felt that insurance companies should be both transparent and accountable for their pricing structures, for such a economically vital, social utility as motor insurance, so that consumers are treated fairly.

attributes.action: Invest more money into front line policing increase number of response officers
attributes.background:
More and more officers are being assaulted each year. With the lack of numbers it will soon become a huge safety issue. 

On top of that, too often we hear the story that response officers to not have the time, resources or funding to deal with/investigate an offence.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 saw a police officer assaulted every 22 minutes in England & Wales. This is a growing number and we need to invest to protect not only the public from these damaging cuts but the officers themselves.

attributes.action: Ban advertising of alcohol, restrict opening times, picture of damaged liver
attributes.background:
In September of this year my partner Claire died due to long term alcohol dependancy, more or less my last words to Claire was that I was going to try and help others in the same situation. 

Being alcohol dependant doesn't just effect the person it also effects close family and friends
attributes.additional_details:
What people don't realise is what damage drinking too much  alcohol can do, in many cases people with liver disease don't have any noticeable symptoms until their live is badly damaged. 
Those systems are.
Jaundice,Oadema, swelling in abdomen, itchy skin, weakness and muscle wasting,insomnia nose bleeds and bleeding gums.
To give you some figures on alcohol abuse it cost the NHS  £2000 per day for a level 3 patient on intensive care It is commonly said that it costs overall to the society £21 bn

attributes.action: Ban cyclists using mobile phones whilst actively riding.
attributes.background: It has become evident, that there is an increasing number of cyclists on UK roads, pavements and cycle ways, utilising their mobile phones whilst actively riding. Not only are they putting themselves and pedestrians at risk, but the driver of road vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: If there were to be an accident involving a car and cyclist, the motorist would face consequences due to damage caused. There is an increasing call for drivers to be safer when it comes to cyclists, and the way in which they use the road (eg passing with enough space) but how do we guard against unsafe cyclists on their mobile devices, taking a call and/or sending a message. It is unsafe for a motorist and therefore unsafe for a cyclist.

attributes.action: Make compulsory DNA testing in order to reduce crime a law
attributes.background: dna helps the police find criminals faster and more efficiently. in order to do this they need to take one mouth swab sample of everyone in the country. This may have negative effects on example would be privacy. But would you give a sample of your dna to keep you and your friends and family safe.

attributes.action: Ask MP's to permanently relocate Parliament to a site in the middle of the UK
attributes.background: This represents a one off window of opportunity to move our primary democratic institution, the House of Commons, to a new site where MP's will be closer to real people and not the Metropolitan elite that dominates their mindset, processes and practices.
attributes.additional_details: It would represent a new start for our democracy, fit for the 21st Century and force our politicians to reassess and challenge the status quo.

attributes.action: Increase the interest rate freelancers can claim for late payment.
attributes.background: Under the Late Payment of Commercial Debts Act 1998, Businesses can claim 8% interest plus the current Bank of England base rate. However this is not enough to deter larger companies from taking advantage of freelancers carrying out non-contracted work, i.e a one-off job.
attributes.additional_details: Late payment can severely impact a freelancer especially during a period of no work therefore it is important that they are able to claim fair compensation, not only to deter companies from exploiting them but to live. If a freelancer were to work one day for £100 and were not paid within 30 days of the client receiving the invoice, the freelancer could claim 8.25% interest (Bank of England base rate of 0.25%) meaning the annual interest would be £8.25 (approximately 0.0226 pence per day).

attributes.action: Organise parade in London for TeamGB and ParalympicsGB following 2016 Rio Games
attributes.background: TeamGB is doing a breathtaking job in Rio and ParalympicsGB will do just the same.  This is a wonderful, breathtaking achievement and something everyone in the UK can take pride in.  We should show our appreciation as a nation by holding a homecoming parade like we did in 2012.

attributes.action: Spend £6m of foreign aid so 40 or Paralympics teams can attend Rio2016
attributes.background: There are around 40 countries that are unable to attend the Paralympics in Rio because of a funding shortfall. As well as being a good thing to do, it would show GB in a good light.  https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2016/aug/14/paralympic-committee-to-hold-budget-crisis-talks-with-brazil

attributes.action: Cancel BoE‘s cash injection to the financial sector, replace it with People's QE
attributes.background: The Bank of England’s planned cash injection to financial services will inflate asset prices, discourage saving and increase inequality. Government should instruct the Bank to implement a programme of People's Quantitative Easing instead to stimulate private spending and reduce UK household debt.
attributes.additional_details: Economists internationally have criticised the Bank’s decision, as it fails to address the greater risk to our economy: businesses and households cutting spending in the wake of increasing economic uncertainty. The BoE’s £375 billion programme of QE has damaged the UK economy since 2009 by inflating asset prices. These policies discourage saving and make it difficult for ordinary people to live, further increasing inequality and resulting suffering and anger that is corrosive to our society.

attributes.action: Hear the voices of the young adult disabled fighting to be heard
attributes.background: From the age of 18 young disabled people are put into the adult age bracket, but little or nothing is offered for this age group. Overnight they lose majority of the help given to children and do not come into account again until they become pensioners. Though mentally they are still children.
attributes.additional_details: Young adults are forgotten when it comes to living as normal a life as possible. Government need to make it law that they are entitled to the same as childrens services instead of leaving it to their parents. Some of who are elderly or even disabled themselves.

attributes.action: Property Council Tax Must be Fair on the Amount of Bedrooms, Not as Now ?
attributes.background: At this time people pay the same amount from a Two Bed to a Six, this is unfair as a Two Bed does Not Create the same Waste as a Three/Four/Five or Six plus, many properties do extensions adding extra Bedrooms without the Councils knowing, Loft Bedrooms added, Brick Sheds made into a Bedroom etc.
attributes.additional_details:
A single person living on their own should Not have to pay the same as a Family of Five Six or More, it is a Loophole and unfair, the Law needs updating as when Rooms are added the Council Must be informed and their Council Tax increased as Appropriate and makes the system fair for All, should be Equal Rights.

Have got a complete list for a road which everyone pays the same from a Two Bed to a Six Bed, very wrong, let's have it fair.

attributes.action: Those with IBD to be allowed parking spaces outside their home
attributes.background: There are an estimated 300,000 people living with IBD in the UK, and not all of these people can register as disabled. This means that those who don't have a driveway or a designated parking space outside their home can struggle to park and get inside quickly when suffering a flare up.
attributes.additional_details:
A painted bay, or a designated parking space outside a sufferer's home would make a great difference.
It's not just IBD, there are thousands of people within the UK that suffer from chronic illness that would benefit from a parking space outside their home.
Local councils will not help as some sufferers cannot register as disabled, and therefore are not legally obliged to help and in may cases won't.
We're not asking to park in disabled bays, just the ability to park outside our own homes.

attributes.action: GET WAITING TIMES OF DRIVING TESTS DOWN TO WITHIN 3 WEEKS
attributes.background: WAITING TIMES FOR DRIVING TESTS AROUND THE COUNTRY ARE GETTING LONGER AT THE MOMENT IT CAN BE AS LONG AS 3 MONTHS, THIS IS CAUSING SEVERE PROBLEMS TO PUPILS AND DRIVING INSTRUCTORS . ALSO TESTS ARE BEING CANCELLED  IN THE WAITING ROOM AND THE PUPILS ARE NOT GETTING THE REQUIRED NOTICE .
attributes.additional_details: IN MY AREA OF WORK THE EARLIEST DRIVING TEST APPOINTMENT IS 1ST NOV  THE DATE TODAY  IS 20TH JULY I WOULD CHALLENGE ANYONE IN THE COUNTRY TO FORECAST 3 MONTHS IN ADVANCE WEATHER A PUPIL WILL BE READY FOR THERE DRIVING TEST .THIS WAITING TIME IS NOT CAUSING JUST EXTRA PRESSURE ON A PUPIL TO PASS 1ST TIME BUT ALSO CAUSING THE DRIVING INSTRUCTOR EXTRA PRESSURE AND MAKING US LOOK LIKE COMPLETE IDIOTS. THE DVSA GET PAID FOR A SERVICE THEY ARE NOT PROVIDING CAUSING UNDUE STRESS AND PROBLEMS

attributes.action: Abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.
attributes.background:
There has been a steady rise in animal abuse in the last few years. In 2011 there was a 23.5% rise in convictions and this is rising.
Many people who have committed these are known for committing  other crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Sign our petition if you think abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.

attributes.action: Full disclosure of Brexit negotiation & allowing a public referendum on the deal
attributes.background: The undersigned insist that David Davis or his successor & any persons that are involved will fully & openly disclose all details of the Brexit deal in detail they have negotiated. We also call on the government to allow the general public a vote on the negotiated deal as its them that are effected.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that it is only fair and right to allow them a vote on the deal that is negotiated in their name as it was back when we joined. People have the right to decide if the deal is the best for the country and the best way the country should go. We would also like to see the implementation of a set percentage of voters that will have to vote and carry the vote say 75% of the entire voting population with at least a 75% turn out of voting population in the UK and its territories.

attributes.action: Justine Greening to bring back GCSE and AS/A2 ICT development.
attributes.background: We urgently need to develop the current GCSE and AS/A2 ICT courses to meet the needs of those students who want to use ICT skills in the workplace. The Computing alternatives do not provide workplace training suitable for the majority of jobs. Digital skills are still needed.

attributes.action: Allow all people with terminal conditions access to trial drugs.
attributes.background: Developing drugs is a lengthy process. When drugs first display effectiveness, the path to approval for use is a long one, to ensure the benefits outweigh any potential risks. But nothing is more risky than death and the terminally ill may be denied potentially life saving treatments in this wait.
attributes.additional_details: The current process of drug development for the terminally ill leaves patients with little power or hope. It feels like what the patient wants is being ignored. In some cases drugs are denied from the rest of the patient population for years after being shown to save lives in the condition, allowing avoidable death on a massive scale. There are many terminal conditions that share this frustration affecting adults and children and babies. Everyone should have the right to the best chance to live.

attributes.action: Abolish extra charges for holidays during school holidays for single travellers
attributes.background: Stop or limit the travel compainies charging a premiuim on holidays for people travelling without children during term breaks.
attributes.additional_details: As a single person who travels alone or with friends its unfair that we have to pay extra for a holiday if its during a school break. This also limits the amount of time we can take off work lossing around 8 weeks per year. A holiday for example to spain costs around £150-£250 more at such times. If like myself due to your work (healthcare) you cant take time off during half of November, all of December and half of January because of school break costs it limits exactly what you can have.

attributes.action: Secure permanent right to reside in the UK for any NHS employee on 23/06/16.
attributes.background: We the undersigned wish that answering 'yes' to the question "Were you working in the NHS on 23/06/16?" means auto-qualification for any future British status.
attributes.additional_details: We cannot risk losing the important foreign peoples that we as a nation have been fortunate enough to bring to the UK and in particular the NHS. Our health would be worse without them and it is imperative that the UK should recognise their importance to our nation by offering them unlimited free passage in to, from and between our country and others.

attributes.action: Highlight the serious issue of mental health as a top Government priority.
attributes.background:
We believe that the Government should prioritise the issue of mental health as a priority.
The issue of mental health affects many families including both adults and children.
We feel that the time has come for Government to be more proactive in addressing this very serious area.

attributes.action: Make disabled spaces legally enforceable and a legal requirement.
attributes.background: While there are disabled bays provided at most buildings with parking, there is no legal requirement to provide them. The spaces are often abused; disabled drivers can very often not get parked in a bay with the space they need to get in and out, and which is close to the entrance.
attributes.additional_details:
Request

I would like two things. Firstly, I would like to see it made a legal requirement for buildings with parking spaces to provide disabled slots.

Secondly, I would like to see it made an offence to park in a disabled space without the appropriate authority - e.g. a blue badge for instance.

attributes.action: Review Visa requirements of the families of serving Commonwealth Soldiers
attributes.background: I highlight the case of a Fijian Soldier who is serving in the British Army who has been separated from his family due to current UK Visa laws. As this soldier does not earn the £27,000 required, his family are forced to remain in Fiji. He is also required to find £6000 just for a Visa application.
attributes.additional_details: The soldier in question served in Afghanistan then discharged from the Army. He subsequently rejoined into the MPGS. His family moved back to Fiji and are now unable to join him. He has seen his family once for 2 weeks in three years. It is unfair to have free movement within Europe yet serving Soldiers are unable to be accompanied due to archaic Visa regulations

attributes.action: Make BBC Parliament exempt from the TV licencing requirements
attributes.background: It is ridiculous at best, and undemocratic at worst, that in order to watch our elected representatives at work we're required to pay the BBC a licence fee. Whilst the argument is understandable for other BBC services, we should not have to pay to watch the democratic process of our country at work.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to run politically-biased opinions on newspaper front-covers.
attributes.background: Newspaper editors often use front-covers as opinion pieces to influence public opinion. For example, in the countdown to the EU referendum, many ran headlines encouraging the public to vote one way or another. We call on an end to this practice. Front-covers should report the news, not opinion.

attributes.action: Hold independence referendums for London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: The people of London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland are at risk of being taken out of the EU, despite voting heavily to remain. If Scotland is granted a 2nd independence referendum as a result of this, then the same choice should be granted to both London and Northern Ireland.
attributes.additional_details:
EU referendum results as reported by the BBC:

London: "Across all 33 boroughs in the capital, 59.9% (2.26 million) voted in favour of remaining in the EU. In some areas, the remain vote was more than 70%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36612916

Scotland: "Scotland has voted in favour of the UK staying in the EU by 62% to 38% - with all 32 council areas backing Remain."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-scotland-politics-36599102

Northern Ireland: "Northern Ireland has voted to remain in the EU Referendum by a majority of 56% to 44%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-36614443

attributes.action: Parliament should vote to decide when we start negotiating to leave the EU
attributes.background: The UK must leave the EU through a well-ordered, timely negotiation. A rushed divorce will damage us both. Article 50.3 of the Lisbon Treaty gives us two years from notification before the Treaties expire. So we should not trigger Article 50 until Parliament votes to say we are ready to negotiate.
attributes.additional_details: The result of the referendum held on 23 June expressed the electorate's wish that the Government negotiate to Leave the EU. The events since make clear that neither the Government nor the Leave campaign have a plan for the UK's negotiation. So Parliament should exercise control over when the negotiation commences. A Parliamentary vote will also make it easier for the European Council to know when the UK has formally notified its intention to withdraw.

attributes.action: We want to delay invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty for at least 3 years
attributes.background: We believe the outcome of the EU Referendum was too close, with almost half over the electorate not wanting to leave the EU, that further investigation of the risks and changes that will occur to the UK need to be studied and popularised with debate and, if necessary more voting processes.
attributes.additional_details:
1) According to Google, “What is the EU?” is the 2nd most searched term about the EU since the announcement of the historic Brexit referendum. In the hours prior to the vote, Google says one of the top questions was “What is Brexit?”. This ignorance will likely cause further dismay to the millions in Britain who are understandably concerned about the massive uncertainty created by Thursday’s vote. 

2) Lack of any plan and renouncing of 'facts' by the biggest voices in the 'leave' campaign.

attributes.action: add units to all special needs schools for children with advanced complex needs
attributes.background: My son Ashton 9 has severe autism severe learning difficulties PDA non verbal at times challenging behaviour.Has been told his special needs school can't cater to his needs the setting isn't right after 6 years that he needs a specialist unit and has to leave BUT there are no units in my region
attributes.additional_details: After been told Ashton has to leave his special needs school after 6 years of been there that the setting is not right And he needs a specialist unit at which I'm appalled can happen to a child after 6 years of routine and relationship building with staff how can this happen ..there's no units the nearest is 2 hours away with a ridicolous waiting list or I can send him to boarding unit miles away mon -fri which is not a option we'd be heartbroken as would he my only option is to home school now

attributes.action: The UK should join EFTA and should stay out of the EEA and Schengen.
attributes.background: So we can maintain free trade with European countries whilst maintaining our borders outside of the EU

attributes.action: Ensure participation in EU free trade, science, security, & environment programs
attributes.background: Now we have voted to leave the EU we must ensure that we will keep access to as many of the EU structures and programs that have been so beneficial to the UK over the years. We ask the government to negotiate access to these programs including free trade, science, security, & environment programs
